topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557de29163687266ce000e9b#post_557de29163687266ce000e9b
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]Another question for those who watched JW:

How in hell nobody knew that Indominus Rex can change color and temperature?! How a special control team that specializes in controlling escaped dinosaurs couldn't know that Indominus can change aspect? 

InGEN created a dinosaur without telling what the dinosaur is made? The people who works in Jurassic World never realized that Indominus can do that? [/bq]
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557de29163687266ce000e9b#post_557de29163687266ce000e9b
That was a plot point that harkens back to the original Jurassic Park film. Where because they needed to splice other animal DNA (In Jurassic Park it was frog DNA) in order for the animal to actually be born. And because they used other genetic sequences the dinos got features from those added animals without anyone realizing it.

In my experince, the first chapters of any manga are what people buys more, which means finding more is very difficult.

topics.body: And let's not forget that all the genetics research in Jurassic World was funded by a man who didn't know how genetics worked. There was a line I really liked when they were talking about Indominus. "You can't ask for exaggerated predatory features without having the instincs that coincide with those features."

topics.body:
Oh yeah so dominus means master, right?
So wouldn't that mean Indominus rex translate's to something like "king with no master"? 

And they expected it _not_ to escape with a name like that???

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557de4586368725080001361#post_557de4586368725080001361
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557de29163687266ce000e9b#post_557de29163687266ce000e9b
That was a plot point that harkens back to the original Jurassic Park film. Where because they needed to splice other animal DNA (In Jurassic Park it was frog DNA) in order for the animal to actually be born. And because they used other genetic sequences the dinos got features from those added animals without anyone realizing it. [/bq]
I know that.
But my point is that Indominus was in a cage for long time. Enough time to know how Indominus acts, if she can do camoflage, if she can modify her temp.
What I mean by this is that the scientist,trainers, investigators and security of Jurassic World had enough time to study her.

Is like Induminus was an alien, humans took her, and put her into a zoo, without knowing any information about her.
